sources.name: Trust – PEW Research Center
sources.description:
Data published by PEW Research Center, using data from various election polls
Linkhttp://www.people-press.org/2015/11/23/public-trust-in-government-1958-2015/
Retrieved27/07/2016

Additional information

For those years with estimates from more than one poll, the reported figure corresponds to the average for that year.

sources.name: US General Social Survey
sources.description:
Data published by 

General Social Survey (GSS)

Linkhttps://gssdataexplorer.norc.org
Retrieved22/07/16

Additional information

The GSS asks the question "Generally speaking, would you say that most people can be trusted or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people?". Available replies are "Can trust", "Cannot trust", "Depends" , "Don't Know" and "No answer".

variables.name: Trust – US GSS
variables.description: Share of survey respondents agreeing with the statement "most people can be trusted"

variables.name: Interpersonal Trust
variables.description: Share of survey respondents agreeing with the statement "most people can be trusted"
